purpose: Enable invited professors to review their invitation details, understand TutorUP's value proposition, and complete their registration seamlessly. Create a welcoming, professional first impression that converts invites to active professors. Build trust and excitement about joining the platform.

current_problems: Generic invite page without platform context
No explanation of benefits for professors
Missing trust signals (security, payment guarantee, support)
No preview of what professor dashboard looks like
Doesn't highlight earning potential or flexibility
Form might be overwhelming if all fields at once
Missing verification of email/phone before full registration
No clear next steps after accepting invite
Doesn't show who sent the invite or why they were selected
ux_flaws: No distinction between invite details and registration flow
Can't preview platform features before committing
No option to ask questions or contact support before accepting
Missing information about payment terms, schedule flexibility
No way to decline invite gracefully
Unclear if they can start teaching immediately or need approval
No indication of required documents or verification steps
ui_inconsistencies: Would need to match TutorUP's professoral brand aesthetic
Need to balance marketing copy with functional registration

design_strategy.visual_identity: Split-screen design: Left = TutorUP value proposition with illustrations and benefits. Right = Invite details + registration form. Purple (#5B21B6) primary, cream (#FFF7ED) accents. Professional, academic, trustworthy aesthetic.
design_strategy.layout_approach: Desktop: Fixed left panel with branding/benefits, scrollable right panel with invite + registration. Mobile: Vertical scroll, value props → invite details → registration form.
design_strategy.component_hierarchy: Invite validation → Welcome hero → Value proposition → Invite details → Benefits list → Registration form (multi-step) → Success confirmation
design_strategy.registration_flow: After accepting invite: 4-step wizard (Personal Info → Professional Background → Subjects & Pricing → Availability Preview → Success)
design_strategy.illustration_strategy: 3 custom flat illustrations: (1) Professor with students (hero), (2) Flexible schedule/earnings icons, (3) Success/welcome celebration.
design_strategy.mobile_differences: Vertical scroll layout. Benefits as collapsible accordion. Sticky CTA button. Form as bottom sheet or separate page after accept.

token_check: On page load: Extract token from URL param
Backend checks: token exists, not used, not expired
If valid: Return invite details (email, inviterName, expirationDate)
If invalid: Return error code (INVALID, EXPIRED, ALREADY_USED)
Frontend shows appropriate state based on response
invite_validation_logic.expiration_policy: Invites valid for 7 days from creation
invite_validation_logic.security: Token is UUID v4, one-time use, expired after acceptance or 7 days

step_1_personal: CPF validation: Format check + digit verification algorithm
Phone validation: Must match (XX) XXXXX-XXXX pattern
Age check: Calculate from birthdate, must be >= 18
CEP auto-fill: Fetch from ViaCEP API on blur, populate address fields
Photo upload: Client-side resize to max 800x800px, compress to <500KB before upload
On Continue: Validate all fields, POST /api/professores/register/step1, save draft to localStorage
step_2_professional: Biografia char counter: Live update, red if <200 or >500
Client-side validation: File size, file type
step_3_subjects: Pricing: Slider updates currency input in real-time
Custom subject: Add button appends to subjects list
step_4_review: Display all collected data from steps 1-3
Edit buttons: Navigate back to specific step, preserve other data
Terms checkboxes: Must check both to enable submit
On Submit: POST /api/professores/register/finalize with invite token
Backend: Create Professor record, mark invite as used, create User with role='professor'
Return JWT token, auto-login, redirect to success screen
registration_flow_logic.draft_saving: Save form state to localStorage after each step completion, restore if user refreshes page

interactions.accept_invite_click: Scroll to registration form, show Step 1, focus first input
interactions.decline_invite_click: Show confirm dialog, if yes: POST /api/convites/decline, show thank you message
interactions.step_navigation: Validate current step, save to backend + localStorage, transition to next/prev step with slide animation
interactions.edit_button_click: Navigate to specific step, highlight edited field, preserve other step data
interactions.terms_checkbox: Enable submit button only when both checked
interactions.cep_input_blur: Fetch from ViaCEP, populate address fields, show loading spinner during fetch
interactions.photo_upload: Show preview, file name, file size, remove button to clear
interactions.subject_add: Append to list, show as pill with remove button
interactions.pricing_slider: Update currency input in real-time, debounce backend save (500ms)
interactions.form_validation: Real-time validation on blur, show error messages below fields, prevent submit if errors exist

error_handling.invalid_token: Show invalid state with back to home button
error_handling.expired_token: Show expired state with request new invite button
error_handling.already_used_token: Show 'This invite has already been used. Please login.' with login link
error_handling.network_error_validation: Show error toast, retry button, check internet connection
error_handling.form_field_error: Show field-specific error message below input, red border, prevent continue
error_handling.age_under_18: 'Você deve ter pelo menos 18 anos para se cadastrar como professor.'
error_handling.registration_failed: Show error modal with retry option, preserve form data, contact support link

accessibility.focus_visible: 2px purple-600 outline on all interactive elements
accessibility.keyboard_navigation: Tab through form fields, Enter to submit/continue, Escape to cancel dialogs
accessibility.screen_reader: Announce step changes, form errors, success messages. Label all inputs properly
accessibility.aria_labels: Progress: 'Step 1 of 4: Personal Information', Buttons: 'Continue to next step', 'Edit personal information'
accessibility.color_contrast: WCAG AA compliance, white text on purple-900 (contrast ratio >7:1)
accessibility.form_validation_announcements: Announce errors to screen readers when validation fails
accessibility.mobile_touch_targets: Minimum 48x48px for all buttons and interactive elements

notes_for_dev: Token validation: GET /api/convites/:token on component mount
Multi-step form state: useState for current step (1-4), useReducer for form data across steps
Draft saving: Save to localStorage after each step, key: 'prof-invite-draft-{token}'
Restore draft: Check localStorage on mount, if exists: prompt 'Continue where you left off?'
CPF validation: Implement CPF checksum algorithm or use library like 'cpf-cnpj-validator'
Photo upload: Use client-side compression library (browser-image-compression)
Form validation: React Hook Form + Zod schemas for each step
Step transition: Framer Motion or CSS transitions for smooth step changes
Terms links: Open /terms and /privacy in new tab
Success redirect: After 3 seconds auto-redirect to /prof/disponibilidade or show manual button
Analytics: Track invite acceptance rate, step abandonment (which step users drop off)
Email verification: Consider sending verification email with code (future enhancement)
Social proof: Fetch real stats from backend for professor count, class count, rating
Testimonial: Rotate between 3-5 real professor testimonials
Invite sender name: If invite.userId is admin, show 'Equipe TutorUP', else fetch user name
performance_considerations: Lazy load ViaCEP only when CEP field is interacted with
Compress uploaded images on client-side before upload (reduce network usage)
Debounce form field validation (300ms) to avoid excessive re-renders
Memoize illustration components to avoid re-rendering
Code-split registration form steps (lazy load step components)
Target page weight: <250KB initial load (with illustrations)
Optimize illustrations: SVG format, gzip compression
future_enhancements: Video intro: Short welcome video from TutorUP team explaining platform
Live chat: Support chat widget for questions before accepting
Referral code: Allow professors to invite other professors with referral bonus
Social login: Option to import info from LinkedIn for professional background
Calendar integration: Import availability from Google Calendar
Sample lesson: Require uploading a sample lesson plan or teaching video
Background check: Optional background check for verified badge
Onboarding tour: Interactive tour of dashboard after registration
Email drip campaign: Follow-up emails guiding through setup steps if incomplete
Multi-language: Support for English/Spanish invites for international professors
